org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.eventbus
Class EventCompoundImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.smartfrog.sfcore.reference.RemoteReferenceResolverHelperImpl
      org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.PrimImpl
          org.smartfrog.sfcore.compound.CompoundImpl
              org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.eventbus.EventCompoundImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.rmi.Remote, MessageKeys, RemoteTags, RemoteTagsComponent, Compound, ChildMinder, Diagnostics, Liveness, Prim, Update, RemoteReferenceResolver, RemoteReferenceResolverHelper, EventAware, EventBus, EventCompound, EventRegistration, EventSink
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConditionCompound, CounterAction, Delay, During, Finally, OnEvent, Parallel, RandomSequence, Repeat, Retract, Retry, Run, Sequence, SlowStart, TestBlockImpl, Timeout, Try
public class EventCompoundImpl
extends CompoundImpl
implements EventBus, EventRegistration, EventSink, EventCompound

An extension of Compound providing the SmartFrog Component event handling and the ability of the subclass to control which children get deployed and when. This compound is a good starting block for implementing any Compound extension with complex lifecycles, as most of the setup is handled, and there are override points to tweak behaviour.

Method Detail

isOldNotationSupported

protected boolean isOldNotationSupported()
This is an override point. The original set of event components suppored the 'old' notation, in which actions were listed in the element New subclasses do not need to remain backwards compatible and should declare this fact by returning false from this method

Returns:
true

sfDeployWithChildren

protected void sfDeployWithChildren()
                             throws SmartFrogDeploymentException
Method that overwrites compoundImpl behavior and delays loading eager components to sfStart phase. If action or actions atributes are present then it behaves like compound and loads all eager components.

Overrides:
sfDeployWithChildren in class CompoundImpl
Throws:
SmartFrogDeploymentException - for deployment problems

scheduleTermination

Override point: schedule a termination triggered from sfTerminatedWith(TerminationRecord, Prim). At this point, it has already been decided that termination can/should be scheduled, so it is. The base class

Parameters:

onWorkflowTerminating

protected boolean onWorkflowTerminating(TerminationRecord status,
                                        Prim comp)
                                 throws SmartFrogRuntimeException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException
This is an override point to handle full component terminations. It is only called during component termination, i.e. when isWorkflowTerminating() is true.

Normally this should return true. If it returns false, then the termination process may not go through cleanly.

Parameters:
status - exit record of the component
comp - child component that is terminating
Returns:
true if the termination event is to be forwarded up the chain.
Throws:
SmartFrogRuntimeException - for runtime exceptions
java.rmi.RemoteException - for network problems

onChildTerminated

protected boolean onChildTerminated(TerminationRecord status,
                                    Prim comp)
                             throws SmartFrogRuntimeException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException
This is an override point; it is where subclasses get to change their workflow depending on what happens underneath. It is only called outside of component termination, i.e. when isWorkflowTerminating() is false, and when the comp parameter is a child, that is CompoundImpl.sfContainsChild(Liveness) holds. If the the method returns true, we terminate the component.

Always return false if you start new components from this method!

Parameters:
status - exit record of the component
comp - child component that is terminating
Returns:
true if the termination event is to be forwarded up the chain.
Throws:
SmartFrogRuntimeException - for runtime exceptions
java.rmi.RemoteException - for network problems

onNonChildTerminated

protected boolean onNonChildTerminated(TerminationRecord status,
                                       Prim comp)
                                throws SmartFrogRuntimeException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException
This is an override point; it is where subclasses get to change their workflow depending on what happens underneath. It is only called outside of component termination, i.e. when isWorkflowTerminating() is false, and when CompoundImpl.sfContainsChild(Liveness) is false. It is not normally overridden, but is there to provide complete coverage.

Parameters:
status - exit record of the component
comp - non-child component that is terminating
Returns:
true if the component is to be terminated
Throws:
SmartFrogRuntimeException - for runtime exceptions
java.rmi.RemoteException - for network problems

isWorkflowTerminating

protected boolean isWorkflowTerminating()
A synchronized check for termination; the termLock is used for the lock.

Returns:
true iff the workflow component is terminating or is already terminated

deployChildCD

protected Prim deployChildCD(java.lang.String childname,
                             boolean required)
                      throws SmartFrogResolutionException,
                             java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             SmartFrogDeploymentException
Helper method to deploy and start any component of a given name. Its template is replaced in the graph by the running component

Parameters:
childname - attribute to look up
required - flag to indicate the component is required
Returns:
the component or null if there was no attribute and required was false.
Throws:
SmartFrogResolutionException - unable to resolve the child and required==true
java.rmi.RemoteException - network problems
SmartFrogDeploymentException - unable to deploy the child

deployComponentDescription

protected Prim deployComponentDescription(java.lang.String childname,
                                          ComponentDescription description)
                                   throws SmartFrogDeploymentException,
                                          SmartFrogLifecycleException
Deploy but do not start a component. If something went wrong with the Prim.sfDeploy(), we start a termination of the errant component and raise a lifecycle exception.

Parameters:
childname - the name of the component
description - the component description to use (a copy is made before deployment)
Returns:
the new child
Throws:
SmartFrogDeploymentException - if it could not deploy
SmartFrogLifecycleException - if something got thrown during deployment
